Hi,

So far I couldn't find anything wrong within the code snippets you provided.

As a starting point, I believe you could check the Silverlight Hands-On Lab: Get Started with the Prism Library which explains step by step how to create a solution using Prism, there a view is added to a region in the Shell using the View Discovery Approach to register the view similarly like you posted above.

Also, you could find more information regarding the use of the View discovery approach and the different approaches you could use to compose your UI in the following chapter of the Prism documentation:

  • Chapter 7: Composing the User Interface

Regarding the use of Commands in your View Models, you could find useful information in the following section of the documentation:

  • Chapter 5: Implementing the MVVM Pattern,Commands

Additionally, I recommend you to check the Prism Training Kit which contains a set of Hands-On-Labs that are meant to help you get familiar with Prism in an easy, interactive way.

I hope you find this handy,
